data.title: Redemption the Truth Behind the Michael Jackson Allegation by Geraldine Hughes
data.meta_description: Redemption: The Truth Behind the Michael Jackson Child Molestation Allegations by Hughes, Geraldine and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Good. Geraldine Hughes comes forth to set the record straight about what really happened behind the scenes in the 1993 child molestation case against Michael Jackson. In Redemption: The Truth Behind the Michael Jackson Child Molestation Allegations, Hughes reveals facts that have never been made public, court documented information, public statements and records that she insists prove Jacksons innocence.The chapters unfold by revealing the key players, highlighting the events leading up to the allegation and giving a thorough description of the legal activities that led Jacksons attorney to settle the case. Redemption is a modern-day mystery that requires a chapter-by-chapter unfolding for all the facts to be known and to redeem an innocent mans character from the cloud of guilt that has been hanging over his head since 1993. Justice can only be served after the truth is told.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. First Edition. The Truth Behind the Michael Jackson Child Molestation Allegations. Includes appendix, excerpts from Geraldine Hughes' diary, plus excerpts from the recorded telephone conversation between Dr. Chandler & Mr. Dave Schwartz. From inner front flap of dustjacket (in part): "For the first time since 1993, the sole legal secretary of Barry Rothman steps forward with new information about the 1993 child molestation case against Michael Jackson and notes the striking resemblance between the 1993 case and the recent allegations. Barry Rothman was, of course, the attorney of Dr. Evan Chandler, the father of the then 13-year old boy whom Mr. Jackson allegedly molested. In order for justice to be served, all the facts have to be presented. Ms. Hughes' reason for writing this book is to let the world know that the entire ordeal was an elaborate plot to extort money from Mr. Jackson. There are facts concerning this case that never came to the public's attention - facts that will cast a shadow of doubt over the allegations". Author Geraldine Hughes, "one of L.A.'s top legal secretaries, worked for Barry Rothman, the attorney who represented the father of the little boy who accused Michael Jackson of child molestation in 1993. She is a 23-year veteran litigation legal secretary with later experience as a law office manager". First printing, with "1" as the lowest number in print number line on copyright page. Printed in the USA. Bound in original black leatherette boards with bright gilt lettering to spine, in publisher's unclipped pictorial dustjacket. Very slight edgewear to dustjacket, otherwise a FINE very nice clean tight solid hardcover copy. 184pp. Scarce title.
